com.wounit.rules

Class TemporaryEditingContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOObjectStore
      • com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOEditingContext
        • er.extensions.eof.ERXEC
          • com.wounit.rules.AbstractEditingContextRule
            • com.wounit.rules.TemporaryEditingContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOKeyValueArchiving, com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOObserving, com.webobjects.foundation.NSDisposable, com.webobjects.foundation.NSLocking, java.io.Serializable, org.junit.rules.MethodRule

    public class TemporaryEditingContext
extends AbstractEditingContextRule
    The TemporaryEditingContext class provides means to create temporary enterprise object for unit testing. It is an editing context configured with the memory adaptor settings that is guaranteed to be reset when the test method finishes (whether it passes or fails).

    This class is useful for integration testing because it mimics the internal behavior of the ERXEC. Every EOEnterpriseObject inserted in the TemporaryEditingContext behaves as a real EO. This kind of feature is useful to validate the behavior of a group of EOs. 

     public class TestMyModel {
     @Rule
     public TemporaryEditingContext editingContext = new TemporaryEditingContext("MyModel");
 
     @Test
     public void testingMyModelLogic() throws Exception {
        MyEntity instance = MyEntity.createMyEntity(editingContext);
        // Do something with instance...
     }
 }
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Henrique Prange
